channel.title: Talks By Gordon B. Hinckley
channel.description: General Conference talks by Gordon B. Hinckley.

image.title: General Conference talks by Gordon B. Hinckley.

item.title: “Except the Lord Build the House …”
item.description: My dear brethren and sisters, humbly I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: “If Ye Be Willing and Obedient”
item.description: My dear brethren and sisters: I am grateful for the prayer of President [Wayne] Shute. I earnestly hope that the petition therein expressed will be answered in our behalf.

item.title: What Will the Church Do for You, a Man?
item.description: In the hope that some may be listening, I wish to direct my remarks to two groups of men who have lost contact with the Church: those who are nominally members, but who are out of touch; and then men everywhere—doubting, hard-headed, thoughtful men w

item.title: Watch the Switches in Your Life
item.description: Wilford Woodruff records that in 1833 all of the priesthood of the Church met with the Prophet Joseph in a room only fourteen feet square, about the size of your bedroom.

item.title: The True Strength of the Church
item.description: My beloved associates in this great work, I never come into this Tabernacle without thinking of the devotion and sacrifice of our pioneer fathers who constructed it as a house of God. They dedicated and consecrated it to worship and the teaching of t

item.title: “We Thank Thee, O God, for a Prophet”
item.description: Thirty-four gifted and inspired speakers have preceded me, and now on this autumn day I feel like the last leaf on the tree as I say a few words before President Lee gives his final counsel and blessing. It is not a new experience for me to speak imm

item.title: The Marriage That Endures
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I am grateful for the invocation offered by Brother Kan Watanabe, my friend and associate with whom I have traveled many thousands of miles up and down Japan in the ministry of the Lord. And I have been inspired by th

item.title: A City Set Upon a Hill
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit that I may say something that will add to your faith. I’ve recently had a great experience. For the better part of a week, with others, I stood in the entrance to the Washington Temple

item.title: The Symbol of Christ
item.description: This has been a great meeting, and I humbly pray that the Spirit of the Lord will prompt me that the things I say may be complementary to the wonderful things which we have heard.

item.title: Opposing Evil
item.description: With appreciation for the tremendous responsibility of speaking from this pulpit, I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: “An Honest Man—God’s Noblest Work”
item.description: If the Lord will inspire me, I desire to speak on what may be regarded as a most ordinary subject. But I believe it to be of the very essence of the gospel. Without the quality of character of which I speak, the fabric of our society will disintegrat

item.title: Everything to Gain—Nothing to Lose
item.description: In this final session, this Sunday afternoon, I am hopeful that somewhere there may be listening—even out of curiosity—a few of those who once were close to the Church, but who, for one reason or another, have drifted away. It is to these that I woul

item.title: Joseph the Seer
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit. Many of us have been gratified recently as we have read in periodicals and seen on television some complimentary references to the Church.

item.title: Welfare Responsibilities of the Priesthood Quorums
item.description: I should like to tell you of an experience I had many years ago while serving as a stake president. I received a telephone call from a bishop who reported that a husband and wife in his ward were seeking a divorce. Having gone beyond all limits of pr

item.title: “Be Not Faithless”
item.description: This conference, my brethren and sisters, is an important anniversary for me. It was an even twenty years ago that I first spoke from this pulpit as a General Authority of the Church. I was filled with fear and feelings of inadequacy that Sunday morn

item.title: “Behold Your Little Ones”
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I pray for the direction of the Holy Spirit in this very serious responsibility.

item.title: And Peter Went Out and Wept Bitterly
item.description: As we approach the end of this morning of inspiration, I should like to take you, for a moment, back to that most dreadful night in and about Jerusalem when the Last Supper was concluded. Jesus and his disciples left the city and went over to the Mou

item.title: “An Angel from on High, the Long, Long Silence Broke”
item.description: We often sing in our congregations a favorite hymn—the words were written well over a century ago by Parley P. Pratt (see no. 224). They represent his declaration of the miraculous coming forth of a remarkable book. Exactly 150 years ago this fall t

item.title: “What Hath God Wrought through His Servant Joseph!”
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, my heart is filled with gratitude for the opportunity to be here. This beautiful new Fayette chapel was made possible by the generosity of some of those present today. We thank you for your great kindness. I am partic

item.title: “Of You It Is Required to Forgive”
item.description: I would like to say thank-you to the choir for that beautiful song of worship, which I hope will serve as something of a frame into which I can place my remarks. These past six months have been a wonderful season for us as a Church. Last spring we us

item.title: The Joseph Smith III Document and the Keys of the Kingdom
item.description: In behalf of all, I should like to welcome Brother Angel Abrea, a great and faithful and devoted leader of the Church for many years in Argentina, whose influence has been felt not only there but throughout South America.

item.title: “Charity Never Faileth”
item.description: My beloved sisters, I speak to you a few words by assignment of President Tanner, President Romney, and President Smith. I am grateful for this theme, the theme of the Relief Society: “Charity never faileth.”

item.title: Faith: The Essence of True Religion
item.description: I suppose there has never been a more generous outpouring of love than that expressed in behalf of President Kimball, our prophet. Unitedly as a people with one heart and one voice we give thanks to the Lord for his blessings and pray for his continu

item.title: Four B’s for Boys
item.description: The Brethren have asked that I now speak to you. This has been a wonderful meeting. I hope that we long remember what we have heard.

item.title: Tithing: An Opportunity to Prove Our Faithfulness
item.description: That’s a great song (“The World Has Need of Willing Men”) and I’m sorry we did not sing the last verse—

item.title: Five Million Members—A Milestone and Not a Summit
item.description: As you have heard, earlier this week the membership of the Church reached five million. This is a significant milestone. It is an occasion for quiet gratitude, but also for sober reflection. Those who laid the foundation of this work must greatly rej

item.title: Sustaining of Church Officers
item.description: There have been no changes among the General Authorities since the last general conference. It is therefore proposed that we sustain all of the General Authorities and general officers of the Church as at present constituted.

item.title: What This Work Is All About
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I am confident that I speak for all of you when I express appreciation to President Kimball for his message just read by his able and faithful secretary, D. Arthur Haycock.

item.title: The Priesthood of Aaron
item.description: “Upon you my fellow servants, in the name of Messiah I confer the Priesthood of Aaron, which holds the keys of the ministering of angels, and of the gospel of repentance, and of baptism by immersion for the remission of sins; and this shall never be

item.title: Reach Out in Love and Kindness
item.description: We were to have heard at this time from Elder LeGrand Richards. He is not able to be with us. We talked with him on the telephone just prior to this meeting. He had hoped that he might be here to give, as it were, his valedictory testimony of this gr

item.title: He Slumbers Not, nor Sleeps
item.description: I hope you enjoyed that magnificent anthem presented by the Choir—“He, Watching Over Israel, Slumbers Not, Nor Sleeps.” It is from Mendelssohn’s and the words are adapted from the Psalms. (See .)

item.title: Overpowering the Goliaths in Our Lives
item.description: I appreciate the large number of boys who make so great an effort to come to these meetings. It is not easy for many of them. We are grateful to you. I should like to say some things particularly to you, and I do so by recounting a portion of a story

item.title: “Fear Not to Do Good”
item.description: My brethren and sisters, ordinarily President Spencer W. Kimball would be occupying this position. I am satisfied that many of you were seriously disappointed that you have not had the opportunity of seeing him or hearing from him on this occasion. A

item.title: Live Up to Your Inheritance
item.description: My beloved sisters, it is a privilege and an honor to be with you.

item.title: Except Ye Are One
item.description: To Latter-day Saints throughout the world, and to men and women of goodwill everywhere: we greet you in the name of the Lord as we gather from near and far in this great world conference of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Be Not Deceived
item.description: My brethren, I pray for the direction of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: God Grant Us Faith
item.description: The Tabernacle Choir has sung “The Morning Breaks.” I think I should like to use those marvelous words written by Parley P. Pratt as something of a theme:

item.title: Let Us Go Forward!
item.description: My brethren and sisters, it has been customary for President Kimball to speak at the conclusion of the conference, but because of his age and the infirmities of his health, that is not possible. I know that you would have appreciated hearing from him

item.title: The Miracle Made Possible by Faith
item.description: Brethren, I think I would like first to express my appreciation for your presence, wherever you are gathered, and particularly thanks to the boys, the young men. Those who are in the Tabernacle came here very early and have been seated here now for t

item.title: Special Witnesses for Christ
item.description: This is a glorious occasion. It is April, the season of spring in this hemisphere, when there is a new stirring of life in all of nature. Soon it will be Easter, the time when the Christian world commemorates the resurrection from the dead of the Son

item.title: Small Acts Lead to Great Consequences
item.description: My brethren and sisters, President Benson said, with a slip of the tongue, that we would hear from President Kimball. I wish with all my heart that we might do so. I wish that he were standing here addressing us as the prophet of the Lord.

item.title: “If Thou Art Faithful”
item.description: The following addresses were given at the general women’s meeting held Saturday evening, 29 September 1984, in the Tabernacle in Salt Lake City. Latter-day Saint women and girls ten and older filled the Tabernacle and Assembly Hall on Temple Square a

item.title: The Good and Faithful Servants
item.description: Now brethren, if I may say just a word. I am going to set aside my prepared talk and speak extemporaneously. This has been a great meeting. Every boy who is here should have had cultivated in his heart tonight an increased desire to go into the world

item.title: The Cornerstones of Our Faith
item.description: A week ago last evening there emanated from this Tabernacle on Temple Square a great conference of the women of the Church. Many thousands participated in that conference, which was carried across the continent from coast to coast. It was an inspirat

item.title: Live the Gospel
item.description: My brothers and sisters, this has been a glorious conference. Only one thing has been lacking, and that is to have heard from the President of the Church, the prophet of the Lord. I wish that President Kimball might have been able to speak to us. We

item.title: To Please Our Heavenly Father
item.description: My brethren, I pray for the inspiration of the Holy Spirit. It is almost anticlimactic to speak after what we have heard. This has been a wonderful meeting, beginning with the opening music of the choir singing Parley P. Pratt’s great plea, “Come, Oh

item.title: The Victory over Death
item.description: A few days before last Christmas a terrible tragedy occurred at one of the large coal mines in central Utah. Twenty-seven miners lost their lives when fire engulfed the long underground slopes and shafts. Many of these were young men with young wives

item.title: God Has a Work for Us to Do
item.description: I am sure that was time well-spent. I wish we might have heard from these Brethren [Elders Ringger, Call, and Camargo] at greater length. They are three wonderful men, and their very presence here this day is to me a testimony of the great power and

item.title: Ten Gifts from the Lord
item.description: “Draw Near unto Me” was the theme of this year’s General Women’s Meeting held Saturday evening, 28 September 1985. The meeting was broadcast by satellite to meetinghouses throughout the Church, where Latter-day Saint women and girls ten years and old

item.title: Joined Together in Love and Faith
item.description: It is a wonderful privilege and blessing to be with you in this great conference. Many more of you are participating in gathering places outside of the Tabernacle than are assembled in the Tabernacle. We welcome you most warmly wherever you may be an

item.title: Questions and Answers
item.description: Brethren, I have appreciated this meeting and all that has been said. I pray for the Spirit of the Lord to guide me in that which I say in conclusion.

item.title: Rejoice in This Great Era of Temple Building
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I feel profoundly grateful for the sustaining faith and prayers of the Latter-day Saints. To stand before you in this capacity is a most serious and sacred responsibility. I claim no special talent. I hope that all of

item.title: “Let Us Move This Work Forward”
item.description: My brethren and sisters, we now bring to a conclusion the 155th Semiannual General Conference of the Church. We have enjoyed a rich and rewarding two days. We have been enlightened and blessed by those who have spoken to us. Our hearts have been lift

item.title: The Question of a Mission
item.description: I have a duty to speak to you. Beyond that, it’s a great privilege and a tremendous opportunity, and I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: Come and Partake
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I greet you with love and sincere appreciation. I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit. Today is the birthday of the Church. It was organized 156 years ago, which was “eighteen hundred and thirty years since the coming of ou

item.title: Solemn Assembly and Sustaining of Church Officers
item.description: President Benson has requested that I now handle the business of the Solemn Assembly for which we are met. This is a tremendously significant and sacred occasion for members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints throughout the world.

item.title: The War We Are Winning
item.description: I noted in the public press the other day that the war between Iran and Iraq has gone on for seven years. No one can ever estimate the terrible suffering incident to that conflict. Lives numbered in the tens of thousands have been lost. The terrible

item.title: The Father, Son, and Holy Ghost
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I have chosen a text this morning that is familiar to all of you. It is the first article of our faith. It is the pivotal position of our religion. It is significant that in setting forth the primary elements of our doctrine,

item.title: Reverence and Morality
item.description: President Benson and the Brethren have asked that I deal with two or three matters of concern to all of us.

item.title: The Lengthened Shadow of the Hand of God
item.description: My brothers and sisters, I am grateful for the privilege and opportunity of being with you in this great world conference. I am thankful that I am alive to see this day of prophecy fulfilled in the mighty work of the Lord.

item.title: Take Not the Name of God in Vain
item.description: Brethren, President Benson has asked that I now speak to you.

item.title: “Lord, Increase Our Faith”
item.description: I add my word of welcome to all who are gathered in this great conference. It has veritably become a world conference. We now speak to congregations throughout North America and instantaneously reach to some across the seas. Hundreds of thousands are

item.title: The Aaronic Priesthood—a Gift from God
item.description: There are thousands of boys here in the Tabernacle tonight, and I think I would like to talk to you. Some of you are twelve years of age.

item.title: The Empty Tomb Bore Testimony
item.description: I desire now to share a few thoughts on the eternal things of God, and I pray for His directing Spirit.

item.title: To the Bishops of the Church
item.description: We have just listened to President Thomas S. Monson, Second Counselor in the First Presidency. President Benson, who gave a wonderful message this morning in opening the conference, has indicated that he will not speak this evening. We are honored wi

item.title: The Healing Power of Christ
item.description: My brothers and sisters, let me tell you of a recent experience. We were in the city of Bacolod on the island of Negros Occidente, in the Republic of the Philippines. There, to my great surprise, I met a man I had not seen in years.

item.title: Magnify Your Calling
item.description: My brethren, this has been a great meeting. I add my congratulations to our beloved President, Ezra Taft Benson, on the recognition he has received. It is an honor well deserved, and it compliments not only him but also the entire Church.

item.title: Let Love Be the Lodestar of Your Life
item.description: We’ve had a wonderful morning where the Spirit of the Lord has been felt. I pray for a continuation of that Spirit.

item.title: Rise to the Stature of the Divine within You
item.description: This Tabernacle has never looked so beautiful as it does on the occasion of these women’s meetings. Thank you for being here. It’s a very difficult act to follow these three able and dedicated women. I commend to you what they have spoken to us this

item.title: The Scourge of Illicit Drugs
item.description: Brethren, this has been a wonderful meeting, in which we have been stirred and uplifted and motivated, and I pray for a continuation of the Spirit of the Lord.

item.title: An Ensign to the Nations
item.description: My brothers and sisters, I very much appreciate Brother Cuthbert’s prayer. It is always an awesome responsibility to speak in this historic Tabernacle. I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit.

item.title: A Word of Benediction
item.description: We come now to the conclusion of this great conference. President Benson asked President Monson in the opening session to read a message from him, which was beautiful and inclusive and of great value to us. He has felt that he would not speak in this

item.title: Keeping the Temple Holy
item.description: Brethren, I commend to you that which we have heard from those who have spoken to us this evening. We have received much of counsel and inspiration, applicable to both men and boys.

item.title: Blessed Are the Merciful
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I sense the awesome burden of speaking to you in this great conference. Tens of thousands of you are listening with great expectation here in the Tabernacle, or in your homes, or in more than two thousand Church buildings. Ma

item.title: “Sacred Resolves”
item.description: Brethren and sisters, traditionally the President of the Church, at the close of the conference, has offered words of benediction. President Benson, who is now in his ninety-first year, feels that he could not stand and address us, but I wish to say

item.title: “This Work Will Go Forward”
item.description: My brethren and sisters, it has been customary for the President of the Church to speak at the opening of the conference. President Benson has asked that I say a few words on his behalf. In doing so, I quote his own language:

item.title: “In … Counsellors There Is Safety”
item.description: First let me say that I have appreciated all that has been said in this meeting. Much has been spoken to the young men. I endorse all of it. I hope that you have had impressed upon your minds the counsel you have heard. If you follow it, it will bles

item.title: Mormon Should Mean “More Good”
item.description: I’d like to first say that our hearts reach out to the family of former governor Scott Matheson, who died this morning, a man that many of us knew and greatly appreciated. We pray that the Spirit of the Lord will comfort those who grieve.

item.title: The State of the Church
item.description: I’ve been very proud of my Brethren tonight. I’ve been proud of them in the two sessions today. We have heard tremendous things this day as we have listened to these men who have dedicated their lives to the service of the Lord. I almost shrink from

item.title: What God Hath Joined Together
item.description: Ten days ago, I had a beautiful and touching experience in the Salt Lake Temple, the building immediately to the east of this tabernacle. There in that holy sanctuary I had the privilege of sealing in marriage, in two separate but consecutive ceremon

item.title: His Latter-day Kingdom Has Been Established
item.description: We have received a telephone call that Elder Derek Cuthbert has just passed away. We have been praying for him. He has served faithfully and diligently and well as a member of the First Quorum of the Seventy—called as a General Authority of the Churc

item.title: Daughters of God
item.description: My dear sisters, I appreciate all that has been said and also the music which has been given us in this meeting. We have been inspired and uplifted. It is very difficult to follow these wonderful women and Elder Ballard. I sense in a very deep and se

item.title: Christ Is the Light to All Mankind
item.description: It is wonderful to have President Benson with us as we open this great world conference of the Church. His smile upon us and the wave of his hand mean much to all of us. Wherever we go—at home or abroad—we receive the same request: “Give our love to

item.title: Our Solemn Responsibilities
item.description: Brethren, we have had an excellent meeting. Much has been spoken worthy of remembrance and application in our lives. I endorse and commend to you what the Brethren have said. I hope that every man and boy, wherever you may be, may leave this meeting

item.title: Our Mission of Saving
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, how blessed we are to meet together in peace in these comfortable and happy circumstances. As I have thought of this October general conference and of the inspired talks we have heard and will hear, my mind has gone b

item.title: “Believe His Prophets”
item.description: My beloved brethren, this has been an inspirational meeting. We have heard much which, if applied, will bless our lives. I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit as I add my testimony. I desire to speak in the spirit of testimony. In so doing, I inten

item.title: “A Chosen Generation”
item.description: My brethren and sisters, I have enjoyed several heartwarming experiences in recent months. I use them as a basis for something I wish to say particularly to the youth and young adults of the Church, many thousands of whom are joined with us in this g

item.title: Our Great Mission
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters, these have been two wonderful days. I hope that we will review and ponder what we have heard. We have feasted on the word of God.

item.title: Sin Will Not Prevail
item.description: My brethren and sisters, President Benson ordinarily would speak to us in the opening session of the conference and extend his warm welcome. We regret that he is not with us. He would wish to be here, and we wish that he were here. It is becoming inc

item.title: Building Your Tabernacle
item.description: I’d like to say that it is always an inspiration to participate in these great priesthood gatherings. There are many conventions and conferences held across the world, but there is no other meeting comparable to this.

item.title: The Church Is on Course
item.description: A few weeks ago, while returning from a regional conference, we had an experience that remains vivid in my mind. As we approached the airport, the captain came on the public address system and spoke in crisp and authoritative tones: “We have an emerg

item.title: Some Lessons I Learned as a Boy
item.description: I think I would like to say a few things to the boys. You older men may listen or sleep. What a wonderful thing it is to be young in this time of the history of the Church and the history of the world. Surely this is the great age of enlightenment. T

item.title: This Peaceful House of God
item.description: I’m sure that you recognize that it is an awesome responsibility to speak to this vast congregation. I seek your faith.

item.title: “A Prophet’s Testimony”
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, we have had two wonderful days. The Spirit of the Lord has been with us. We have listened to inspired addresses, beautiful prayers, and uplifting music.

item.title: My Testimony
item.description: I congratulate most warmly President Monson on the honor given him. The ecologists would say that it is good to have a wolf among us. This is a well-deserved recognition for years of faithful service to Scouting, a program which the Church has now sp

item.title: Bring Up a Child in the Way He Should Go
item.description: My brethren and sisters, near and far: I extend to each of you my love and gratitude. I am deeply grateful for your sustaining faith and prayers. We need your prayers. We desire always to be worthy of them. Many of you write letters of encouragement

item.title: God Is at the Helm
item.description: I’m grateful for the singing of those words by the choir earlier in the meeting. My beloved brethren, this has been a wonderful meeting in which the inspiration of the Lord has been made manifest. I sense keenly the responsibility of speaking to you.

item.title: The Greatest Miracle in Human History
item.description: My beloved brethren and sisters, I add my testimony to the testimony of my brethren this Easter morning. For all of Christendom, for all of mankind, today is observed as the anniversary of the greatest miracle in human history. It is the miracle that

item.title: The Solemn Assembly Sustaining of Church Officers
item.description: Brothers and sisters, President Hunter has requested that I now handle the business of the solemn assembly for which we are met. This is an occasion of great significance for members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints throughout the w

item.title: Don’t Drop the Ball
item.description: My brethren, as I have listened to the proceedings of the conference this day, I have thought of what a glorious organization this is—this Church of Jesus Christ, moving forward in these latter days under the leadership of a true prophet, whom we sus

item.title: Save the Children
item.description: My brethren and sisters, it becomes my responsibility to open this session in speaking to you.

item.title: The Light within You
item.description: My beloved associates in this great work, you wonderful young women and your mothers, I am not here tonight as a scheduled speaker. I wasn’t on the program originally. Nevertheless, I welcome this opportunity to say a few words of postscript to the v

item.title: This Work Is Concerned with People
item.description: Thank you, brethren, for the effort you have made to come to this great worldwide priesthood meeting. Wherever you may be, we thank you and commend you for your faith, for your loyalty to this the work of the Lord, for the efforts you make in your da

item.title: This Is the Work of the Master
item.description: My beloved brothers and sisters wherever you may be, my dear friends and associates in this great work, as you can well understand, this for me is a most solemn and sacred occasion. Humbly I seek the direction of the Holy Spirit as I struggle to shar

item.title: We Have a Work to Do
item.description: My brethren and sisters, just a few words in conclusion. First, I’d like to say that we have participated in a miracle. As I have listened to all who have spoken, I have noted that there has been no duplication of treatment. Every man and woman who h

item.title: Stand Strong against the Wiles of the World
item.description: I am greatly honored in the invitation to participate with you. My beloved companion, Marjorie, would do better in addressing the Relief Society than I. I honor her as the Relief Society member of our family and because of her and her activities, my

item.title: As We Gather Together
item.description: My brethren and sisters, it is wonderful that we have the opportunity of meeting together each six months in these great world conferences. We gather from over the earth to bear our testimonies one to another, to hear instruction, to mingle as brethr

item.title: Of Missions, Temples, and Stewardship
item.description: Now, if I may have an interest in your faith and prayers, I hope to be able to say something that is helpful. Last Saturday evening, one week ago, a great Relief Society conference was held in this Tabernacle. It was an inspiring experience to look i

item.title: Stay the Course—Keep the Faith
item.description: My brethren and sisters, thank you for your sustaining hands and hearts, and for your expressions of confidence and love. My faith in this great work has been strengthened by what I have seen and heard as I have traveled among you during the past six

item.title: The Fabric of Faith and Testimony
item.description: This has been a most remarkable thing, this conference. We have listened to twenty-eight different speakers. No one was assigned a topic on which to speak. Each was free to choose his or her message. There is always the risk of repetition in that. Bu

item.title: Stand True and Faithful
item.description: This has been a very touching, humbling, and overwhelming experience. Thank you for your kindness and your love.

item.title: “Be Ye Clean”
item.description: We have had a wonderful meeting. The Spirit of the Lord has been with us. I hope that each of us has gained much from what we have heard.

item.title: This Glorious Easter Morn
item.description: Now, my brothers and sisters, if I may say a few words. First, I’d like to say that it’s wonderful to see all of you gathered in the Tabernacle this Easter morning. You’re a wonderful sight. It is a remarkable thing to contemplate the many more who a

item.title: “Remember … Thy Church, O Lord”
item.description: This has been a wonderful conference. The Spirit of the Lord has been with us. We have heard much of wisdom and inspiration. Our testimonies of this divine work have been strengthened. Many of us, I hope, have resolved within our hearts to live more

item.title: Listen by the Power of the Spirit
item.description: We have gathered here in the historic Tabernacle on Temple Square in Salt Lake City. Others are joining us in thousands of other halls and in their homes across America and across the world. We are deeply grateful for the means of communication affor

item.title: “This Thing Was Not Done in a Corner”
item.description: My dear brethren, we have received good counsel this evening.

item.title: Women of the Church
item.description: Half, possibly more than half, of the adult members of the Church are women. It is to them that I wish particularly to speak this morning. I do so with the hope that the men will also hear.

item.title: “Reach with a Rescuing Hand”
item.description: Just a few words as we bring to a close this great general conference of the Church. It’s been a wonderful occasion. The weather has favored us here in Salt Lake City. This is a beautiful season of the year, with the fall flowers in bloom. The harves

item.title: May We Be Faithful and True
item.description: The Lord is watching over His kingdom. He is inspiring its leadership to care for its ever-growing membership.

item.title: Converts and Young Men
item.description: Every convert is precious. Every convert is a son or daughter of God. Every convert is a great and serious responsibility.

item.title: “True to the Faith”
item.description: With so great an inheritance, we can do no less than our very best. Those who have gone before expect this of us. We have a mandate from the Lord.

item.title: Our Testimony to the World
item.description: God is at the helm. We will seek His direction. We will listen to the still, small voice of revelation. And we will go forward as He directs.

item.title: Drawing Nearer to the Lord
item.description: God is our Father who watches over His kingdom. Jesus is the Christ whose name this Church bears. He stands at its head.

item.title: Some Thoughts on Temples, Retention of Converts, and Missionary Service
item.description: May you look upon the Church as your great and good friend, your refuge when the world appears to be closing around you, your hope when things are dark, your pillar of fire.

item.title: Look to the Future
item.description: The key to the success of the work will be the faith of all who call themselves Latter-day Saints.

item.title: Latter-day Saints in Very Deed
item.description: I love you. I love the people of this Church. I love all who are faithful. I love all who follow the ways of the Lord.

item.title: Living Worthy of the Girl You Will Someday Marry
item.description: Make yourself worthy of the loveliest girl in all the world. Keep yourself worthy through all the days of your life.

item.title: Testimony
item.description: This thing which we call testimony is the great strength of the Church. It is the wellspring of faith and activity. It is difficult to explain. It is difficult to quantify … , yet it is as real and powerful as any force on the earth.

item.title: New Temples to Provide “Crowning Blessings” of the Gospel
item.description: May the windows of heaven be opened and blessings be showered down upon us as a people as we walk with boldness and in faith before the Lord to accomplish His eternal work.

item.title: Walking in the Light of the Lord
item.description: My message to you, my challenge to you, my prayer is that you will rededicate yourselves to the strengthening of your homes.

item.title: To the Boys and to the Men
item.description: I am suggesting that the time has come to get our houses in order.

item.title: What Are People Asking about Us?
item.description: I … wish to set forth, as simply as I know how, my response to what people are asking.

item.title: Benediction
item.description: These are momentous times in which we are living as Saints of the Most High. … Let us go on rearing our children in righteousness and truth. Let us be good neighbors and good friends.

item.title: The Work Moves Forward
item.description: The Church goes forward on its appointed mission in the direction of its appointed destiny.

item.title: The Shepherds of the Flock
item.description: I carry in my heart a deep appreciation for our bishops. I am profoundly grateful for the revelation of the Almighty under which this office was created and functions.

item.title: “He Is Not Here, but Is Risen”
item.description: These simple words—“He is not here, but is risen”—have become the most profound in all literature. … They are the fulfillment of all He had spoken concerning rising again.

item.title: Thanks to the Lord for His Blessings
item.description: Great are our blessings. Tremendous is our responsibility. Let us … march forward without fear to enlarge among people everywhere the righteousness of the Lord.

item.title: Why We Do Some of the Things We Do
item.description: This … is not a cause of ease nor a work without effort, even sacrifice. We shall go on pursuing the path which the Lord has marked out before us.

item.title: At the Summit of the Ages
item.description: May God bless us with a sense of our place in history and … our need to stand tall and walk with resolution in a manner becoming the Saints of the Most High.

item.title: Good-bye to This Wonderful Old Tabernacle
item.description: The Spirit of the Lord has been in this [Tabernacle]. It is sacred unto us. We hope, we anticipate, we pray that the new [Conference Center] will likewise radiate the same spirit.

item.title: To All the World in Testimony
item.description: In this great hall … the voices of prophets will go out to all the world in testimony of the Redeemer of mankind.

item.title: The Stake President
item.description: Stake presidents have been called under the same inspiration under which the General Authorities were called. I pray for these, my beloved brethren, that the Spirit of the Lord will rest upon them.

item.title: My Testimony
item.description: Of all the things for which I feel grateful … , one stands out preeminently. That is a living testimony of Jesus Christ.

item.title: A Time of New Beginnings
item.description: Let us take a little time to meditate, to think of what we can do to improve our lives and to become better examples of what a Latter-day Saint should be.

item.title: Your Greatest Challenge, Mother
item.description: I know of no better answer to [the] foul practices that confront our young people than the teachings of a mother, given in love with an unmistakable warning.

item.title: A Great Family in Reverence and Worship
item.description: We speak words of testimony concerning God our Eternal Father and His Beloved Son.

item.title: “Great Shall Be the Peace of Thy Children”
item.description: In terms of your happiness, in terms of the matters that make you proud or sad, nothing—I repeat, nothing—will have so profound an effect on you as the way your children turn out.

item.title: This Great Millennial Year
item.description: This work is possessed of a vitality which has never been evidenced before to such a degree.

item.title: “An Humble and a Contrite Heart”
item.description: If we have drawn nearer to the Savior, with a more firm resolution to follow His teachings and His example, then this conference will have been a wonderful success.

item.title: How Can I Become the Woman of Whom I Dream?
item.description: You are daughters of the Almighty. Limitless is your potential. Magnificent is your future, if you will take control of it.

item.title: The Work Goes On
item.description: Let us be good people. Let us be friendly people. Let us be neighborly people. Let us be what members of The Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints ought to be.

item.title: The Perpetual Education Fund
item.description: Where there is widespread poverty among our people, we must do all we can to help them to lift themselves, to establish their lives upon a foundation of self-reliance that can come of training. Education is the key to opportunity.

item.title: The Miracle of Faith
item.description: Faith is the basis of testimony. Faith underlies loyalty to the Church. Faith represents sacrifice, gladly given in moving forward the work of the Lord.

item.title: Good-bye for Another Season
item.description: These conferences are held … to strengthen our testimonies of this work, to fortify us against temptation and sin, to lift our sights, to receive instruction.

item.title: Living in the Fulness of Times
item.description: Notwithstanding the afflictions about us, notwithstanding the sordid things we see almost everywhere, notwithstanding the conflict that sweeps across the world, we can be better.

item.title: Reaching Down to Lift Another
item.description: Let us open our hearts, let us reach down and lift up, let us open our purses, let us show a greater love for our fellowmen.

item.title: The Times in Which We Live
item.description: Our safety lies in repentance. Our strength comes of obedience to the commandments of God.

item.title: “Till We Meet Again”
item.description: Our safety lies in the virtue of our lives. Our strength lies in our righteousness. God has made it clear that if we will not forsake Him, He will not forsake us.

item.title: The Church Goes Forward
item.description: No other church to come out of the soil of America has grown so fast nor spread so widely. … It is a phenomenon without precedent.

item.title: Personal Worthiness to Exercise the Priesthood
item.description: Our behavior in public must be above reproach. Our behavior in private is even more important. It must clear the standard set by the Lord.

item.title: We Walk by Faith
item.description: We reach toward the unknown, but faith lights the way. If we will cultivate that faith, we shall never walk in darkness.

item.title: We Look to Christ
item.description: Like the polar star in the heavens, … there stands the Redeemer of the world, the Son of God, certain and sure as the anchor of our immortal lives.

item.title: “O That I Were an Angel, and Could Have the Wish of Mine Heart”
item.description: I urge you … to utilize the temples of the Church. Go there and carry forward the great and marvelous work which the God of heaven has outlined for us.

item.title: To Men of the Priesthood
item.description: You men who hold this precious priesthood, bind it to your very souls. Be worthy of it at all times and in all circumstances.

item.title: The Marvelous Foundation of Our Faith
item.description: God be thanked for His marvelous bestowal of testimony, authority, and doctrine associated with this, the restored Church of Jesus Christ.

item.title: Each a Better Person
item.description: There is room for improvement in every life. … Regardless of our circumstances, we can improve ourselves and while so doing have an effect on the lives of those about us.

item.title: The Condition of the Church
item.description: The gospel of Jesus Christ is the way of peace. To the extent we follow it and incorporate it in our lives … will we be blessed and prospered.

item.title: Loyalty
item.description: Be loyal to the best that is in you. Be faithful and true to the covenants that are associated with the priesthood of God.

item.title: War and Peace
item.description: I hope that the Lord’s people may be at peace one with another during times of trouble, regardless of what loyalties they may have to different governments or parties.

item.title: Benediction
item.description: I offer a plea that each of us will seek to live closer to the Lord and to commune with Him more frequently and with increased faith.

item.title: To the Women of the Church
item.description: Thank you for being the kind of people you are and doing the things you do. May the blessings of heaven rest upon you.

item.title: The State of the Church
item.description: This is only the beginning. We have scarcely scratched the surface. We are engaged in a work for the souls of men and women everywhere.

item.title: The Shepherds of Israel
item.description: I thank the Lord for good bishops in this Church. … May you know that peace which comes alone from God to those who serve Him.

item.title: An Ensign to the Nations, a Light to the World
item.description: If we are to [be] an ensign to the nations and a light to the world, we must take on more of the luster of the life of Christ.

item.title: Let Us Live the Gospel More Fully
item.description: What a tremendous work you are doing, you faithful Latter-day Saints all across the world, who carry in your hearts a firm and unswerving testimony.

item.title: Stay on the High Road
item.description: Pray for the strength to walk the high road, which at times may be lonely but which will lead to peace and happiness and joy supernal.

item.title: The Church Grows Stronger
item.description: There is much more yet to be done, but what has been accomplished is truly phenomenal.

item.title: “I Was an Hungred, and Ye Gave Me Meat”
item.description: Wherever want has been created by whatever cause, representatives of the Church have been there. … I have been a firsthand witness to the effectiveness of our humanitarian efforts.

item.title: The Dawning of a Brighter Day
item.description: What a glorious season it has been and now is. A new day has come in the work of the Almighty.

item.title: Concluding Remarks
item.description: May our testimonies of the great foundation principles of this work … shine forth from our lives and our actions.

item.title: Condition of the Church
item.description: I believe the Church is in better condition than it has been at any time in its entire history.

item.title: A Tragic Evil among Us
item.description: [Pornography] is like a raging storm, destroying individuals and families, utterly ruining what was once wholesome and beautiful.

item.title: The Women in Our Lives
item.description: How thankful I am, how thankful we all must be, for the women in our lives.

item.title: Closing Remarks
item.description: I would hope that we might go to the house of the Lord a little more frequently.

item.title: Opening Remarks
item.description: Our burden in going forward is tremendous. But our opportunity is glorious.

item.title: Gambling
item.description: If you have never been involved in poker games or other forms of gambling, don’t start. If you are involved, then quit now while you can do so.

item.title: The Great Things Which God Has Revealed
item.description: On the solid foundation of the Prophet Joseph’s divine calling and the revelations of God, which came through him, we go forward.

item.title: Closing Remarks
item.description: Surely the Lord is blessing us as a people, and we must reach out to bless His needy wherever they may be.

item.title: Opening Remarks
item.description: The growth of the Church from its infancy to its present stature is phenomenal, and we have only scratched the surface.

item.title: If Ye Are Prepared Ye Shall Not Fear
item.description: We can so live that we can call upon the Lord for His protection and guidance. … We cannot expect His help if we are unwilling to keep His commandments.

item.title: Forgiveness
item.description: Somehow forgiveness, with love and tolerance, accomplishes miracles that can happen in no other way.

item.title: Benediction
item.description: God our Eternal Father lives. … Jesus is the Christ, the Redeemer of mankind. They have restored Their work in this last and final dispensation through the instrumentality of the Prophet Joseph.

item.title: The Need for Greater Kindness
item.description: Why do any of us have to be so mean and unkind to others? Why can’t all of us reach out in friendship to everyone about us?

item.title: Seek Ye the Kingdom of God
item.description: I hope that all of you will remember that on this Sabbath day you heard me bear my witness that this is God’s holy work.

item.title: Until Again We Meet
item.description: May we remember and constantly express in our lives the counsel we have received.

item.title: In the Arms of His Love
item.description: This is the greatest women’s organization in all the world. It is a God-given creation.

item.title: We Bear Testimony to the World
item.description: The Lord is richly blessing His Church, and our duty is to do all we can to move it forward.

item.title: Rise Up, O Men of God
item.description: With this priesthood comes a great obligation to be worthy of it.

item.title: The Faith to Move Mountains
item.description: Increased faith is what we most need. Without it, the work would stagnate. With it, no one can stop its progress.

item.title: Closing Remarks
item.description: We leave with you our love and our blessing. May the Spirit of the Lord dwell in your homes.

item.title: Let Virtue Garnish Thy Thoughts Unceasingly
item.description: There is no limit to your potential. If you will take control of your lives, the future is filled with opportunity and gladness.

item.title: A Tabernacle in the Wilderness
item.description: This has been a unique and wonderful place of assembly.

item.title: “I Am Clean”
item.description: Be clean—in language, in thought, in body, in dress.

item.title: The Things of Which I Know
item.description: I wish to give you my testimony of the basic truths of this work.

item.title: Closing Remarks
item.description: What has been said by each of the speakers represents his or her prayerful attempt to impart knowledge that will inspire.

item.title: Slow to Anger
item.description: May the Lord bless you and inspire you to walk without anger.

item.title: The Stone Cut Out of the Mountain
item.description: The Lord is fulfilling His promise that His gospel shall be as the stone cut out of the mountain without hands.

item.title: Closing Remarks
item.description: We have been inspired and lifted to a higher appreciation of this wonderful gospel.
